Charisma be your spellcasting ability for your bard spell. Your magic come from the heart and soul you pour into the performance of your music or oration. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when set the save throw DC for a bard spell you cast and when make an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC= 8+ your proficiency bonus+ your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier= your proficiency bonus+ your Charisma modifier
You can cast any bard spell you know a a ritual if that spell have the ritual tag.

You can inspire others through stir word or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 foot of you who can hear you. That creature gain one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6.

Once within the next 10 minute, the creature can roll the die and add the number roll to one ability check, attack roll, or save throw it make. The creature can wait until after it roll the d20 before decide to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM say whether the roll succeed or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die be roll, it be lose. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.
You can use this feature a number of time equal to your Charisma modifier( a minimum of once). You regain any expend us when you finish a long rest.
Your Bardic Inspiration die change when you reach certain level in this class. The die becomes a d8 at 5th level, a d10 at 10th level, and a d12 at 15th level.
Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, round down, to any ability check you make that do n't already include your proficiency bonus.

Beginning at 2nd level, you can use soothe music or oration to help revitalize your wound ally during a short rest. If you or any friendly creature who can hear your performance regain hit point at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creature regains an extra 1d6 hit point.
The extra Hit Points increase when you reach certain level in this class: to 1d8 at 9th level, to 1d10 at 13th level, and to 1d12 at 17th level.

At 2nd level, if a creature have a Bardic Inspiration die from you and cast a spell that restores hit point or deal damage, the creature can roll that die and choose a target affected by the spell. Add the number roll a a bonus to the hit point regain or the damage dealt. The Bardic Inspiration die be then lose.
